Hiro Edward Sato (Japanese: ヒロ・エドワード・サトウ, born March 9, 1973) is a Japanese American photographer, filmmaker, and creative director. He is the founder and CEO of Silver Fox Production ATL, Inc. specializing in commercial photography, music videos, and documentary filmmaking.
Sato has worked with numerous musicians, actors, and sports figures, including Tetsuya Komuro (TM NETWORK), MIYAVI, Dream Ami, Ai Tominaga, and Yuto Horigome. His work has been featured in advertising campaigns, magazines, CDs, DVDs, and digital media. He has also directed music videos and documentaries for Ryota Fujimaki (Remioromen), Bad Hop, Fruits Zipper, and TRF.
Early Life and Background
Hiro Edward Sato was born in London, United Kingdom, as Hiroyasu Edward Sato (佐藤 弘康). His father's job required frequent relocation, and he spent much of his early life in both the United Kingdom and the United States. He is the second of three siblings.
Career
Photography
Sato began his career in 1991 in Hawaii and New York before expanding internationally. He is known for his work in advertising, sports, concerts, portrait, lifestyle, and event photography. Currently, he is based in Atlanta, Georgia and Tokyo, Japan. His work has been published in various advertisements, newspapers, magazines, CDs, DVDs, and online media.
He primarily uses Leica cameras.

Business and Filmmaking
As the CEO of Silver Fox Production ATL, Inc., Sato oversees video production, commercials, marketing content, and documentary filmmaking. His company also specializes in aerial photography, bilingual content production, translation, event photography, and graphic design.
